question.long: Do security cameras help reduce crime rates in surveilled areas?

description: Results from studies evaluating the effectiveness of security cameras (CCTV) in preventing and reducing criminal activities.

no_consensus.description: The literature has not yet reached a consensus on the effectiveness of security cameras in reducing crime

no.description: The literature suggests that security cameras do not significantly reduce crime rates

yes.description: The literature suggests that security cameras are effective in reducing crime rates

no.description: The results show no significant effect of security cameras on crime rates

no_unlike_literature.description: The results show no effect, contradicting previous literature suggesting positive effects

no_but_mixed_results.description: The results show limited or inconsistent effects on different types of crimes

maybe.description: The results are inconclusive or require more research

yes_but_low_confidence.description: The results suggest a positive effect but with low statistical confidence

yes_but_small_effect.description: The results show a statistically significant but small reduction in crime rates

yes_unlike_literature.description: The results show positive effects, contradicting previous literature suggesting no effects

yes.description: The results show significant reduction in crime rates with security camera implementation
